passage_text: poly-. combining form. 1. more than one; many or much: polyhedron.
Poly, from the Greek πολύς meaning many or much, may refer to:
Definition of POLY. : a polymerized plastic or something made of this; especially: a polyester fiber, fabric, or garment. ADVERTISEMENT. short for polymer.

Poly- (prefix). Poly- (prefix): Poly-as a prefix means much or many. From the Greek polys, many. The prefix poly- appears, just for a few examples, in polyarteritis, polycystic, polycythemia, polydipsia, polygenic, polyhydramnios, polymerase, polymyalgia, polymyositis, polyp, etc.
